channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Who is J.D. Vance, Trump’s VP pick? And, an R&B jam addresses climate change
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has selected Sen. J.D. Vance of Ohio as his running mate for the presidential election. Here’s more about him. And, a sultry R&B song about heat pumps.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump has selected Sen. J.D. Vance of Ohio as his running mate for the presidential election. Here’s more about him. And, a sultry R&B song about heat pumps.

(Image credit: Bloomberg/Bloomberg via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: On Day 1 of the RNC, Trump announced he picked Sen. J.D. Vance as his running mate
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Caroline Sunshine, deputy communications director for the Trump campaign, about the convention and if the assassination attempt on ex-President Trump changed its plans.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Caroline Sunshine, deputy communications director for the Trump campaign, about the convention and if the assassination attempt on ex-President Trump changed its plans.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Teamsters President Sean O'Brien addresses the Republican National Convention
item.description: In recent history, labor unions overwhelmingly back Democrats. President Biden calls himself the most pro-union president ever. But at the RNC, the head of the teamsters had a prime speaking slot.
item.content:encoded: In recent history, labor unions overwhelmingly back Democrats. President Biden calls himself the most pro-union president ever. But at the RNC, the head of the teamsters had a prime speaking slot.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Former President Trump chooses Sen. J.D. Vance of Ohio as his running mate
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Jonah Goldberg, editor and co-founder of The Dispatch, about the choice of Vance, who once described former President Trump using words like “idiot” and “Hitler.”
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Jonah Goldberg, editor and co-founder of The Dispatch, about the choice of Vance, who once described former President Trump using words like “idiot” and “Hitler.”
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: A Palestinian American raises more than $1 million to feed his family and others in Gaza
item.description: U.S. Palestinians are helping their families evacuate, rebuild, and buy basics like food.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. Palestinians are helping their families evacuate, rebuild, and buy basics like food.

(Image credit: Michael A. McCoy for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Marisa Peñaloza

item.title: Dollar General will pay $12 million in fines over workplace safety violations
item.description: The agreement says the chain must correct any future safety violations regarding blocked exits or access to fire extinguishers and electrical panels — or face fines of up to $500,000 per violation.
item.content:encoded:
The agreement says the chain must correct any future safety violations regarding blocked exits or access to fire extinguishers and electrical panels — or face fines of up to $500,000 per violation.

(Image credit: Sue Ogrocki)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Tracing USA Gymnastics' journey from rock bottom back to Olympic dominance
item.description: Six years ago, USA Gymnastics was on the brink of collapse amid a sex abuse scandal that had cost it sponsorships and piled up lawsuits. Now, the organization hopes it has turned the page.
item.content:encoded:
Six years ago, USA Gymnastics was on the brink of collapse amid a sex abuse scandal that had cost it sponsorships and piled up lawsuits. Now, the organization hopes it has turned the page.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: California’s wildfires are burning far more land so far this year than in 2023
item.description: Cal Fire Chief Joe Tyler said the agency and its partners are equipped with with fire trucks, bulldozers, and newly introduced Blackhawk helicopters that can fly at night.
item.content:encoded:
Cal Fire Chief Joe Tyler said the agency and its partners are equipped with with fire trucks, bulldozers, and newly introduced Blackhawk helicopters that can fly at night.

(Image credit: Eric Thayer)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: The best games of 2024 so far, picked by the NPR staff
item.description: NPR staff and contributors share their favorite video games of 2024 so far.
item.content:encoded: NPR staff and contributors share their favorite video games of 2024 so far.
item.dc:creator: James Perkins Mastromarino

item.title: Her hearing implant was preapproved. But she still received multiple $139,000 bills
item.description: Even when patients double-check that their care is covered by insurance, health providers may send them bills as they haggle with insurers over reimbursement. It's stressful and annoying — but legal.
item.content:encoded:
Even when patients double-check that their care is covered by insurance, health providers may send them bills as they haggle with insurers over reimbursement. It's stressful and annoying — but legal.

(Image credit: Nick Oxford)
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Rosenthal
